abstract.title: Introduction
abstract.para: The libiers10++ library includes a variety of functions, implementing the models defined by IERS in technical note 36, IERS Conventions (2010). The document is available in the IERS website.

The IERS, has a dedicated website, where official implementations of these models are distributed, via source code in FORTRAN programing language. Updates can be found here. The source code and documents can be downloaded and used, following the terms and conditions defined therein.

libiers10++ was developed in Dionysos Satellite Observatory of the National Technical University of Athens, to assist its own geodesy-oriented scientific activities. To that end, most of the IERS routines were translated and compiled into a library for further use. The main programing language used in the Laboratory is C++, consequently, the library is written in this language.

section.title: Source Code
section.para: The languge of choice for the source code is Standard C++. The current ISO C++ standard, known as C++11, is used.

note.para: The library uses a number of C++11 features, so make sure you use a compiler with support for this ISO version.

section.title: Contents and Structure
section.para:
The structure of the Package, should look like the following (before installation), where only directories are listed :
iers2010/ ├── alternatives ├── doc │ └── xml ├── script ├── src └── test └── fortran
8 directories
The contents of each folder, are: Folders in the libiers10++ Package
alternatives/
Contains a number of source code files, that could be implemented in the Package library, but do NOT belong to the official implementation. These files are for mainly for developer use (see ).
doc/
This folders contains documentation (ascii) files in XML format. These files are compiled into the Package's documentation, in various formats, in the building process (see MISSING NITERNAL LINK).
script/
This folder contains scripts mainly to assist or complete the installation process (see MISSING NITERNAL LINK).
src/
The source code files of the Project are placed here (.cpp and .h files).
test/
This directory contains test implementation/programs for the library (see MISSING NITERNAL LINK). The folder test/fortran contains a FORTRAN test example source file, to test the FORTRAN implementation(s) of the models.
Files in the libiers10++ Package (root directory)
AUTHORS
Lists authors and contibutors of the Package
ChangeLog
Describes changes made to program source files (see the GNU Coding Standards).
configure
Configure script to be used in the building process. This is an executable script, designed to aid in developing a program to be run on a wide number of different computers. This file is used in the building process (see MISSING NITERNAL LINK).
configure.ac
File created and used by the GNU Build System. This file is only needed if you modify the Package.
COPYING
This file holds the Copyright information for the Package
INSTALL
Detailed installation information; hopefully, you will not have to read this.
NEWS
This file holds the latest news regarding the Package development; bugs, bugfixes, releases, etc.
README and README.md
Readme files, in MarkDown and plain ascii format.
aclocal.m4, depcomp, install-sh, missing and test-driver
Files that may be used (automatically implemented) in the building process.

section.title: The alternatives directory
section.para: It is worth noting again, that the source files included in the alternatives folder are NOT part of the libiers10++ library. In fact, the source code in this directory is not even build (although users can compile it if they choose to).

For the most part, this is an experimental directory where users/developers can edit, create, modify and subsequently easily build source code. Hopefully, in later versions of the Package, this folder will contain (alternative) source code to replace (if wanted by the individual users) default implementations in the src folder.

To build the source code in this directory, you will need to modify two files:
alternatives/Makefile.am Modify this file to represent the changes you have made (or leave as is to build the source code distributed in this folder).
Makefile.am (in the Project root directory) Modify this file, adding the alternatives directory to the SUBDIRS target. In such a case, the root direcory Makefile.am should consist of one line: SUBDIRS = src test doc script alternatives Then re-run (execute) configure.ac to create a valid Makefile.in and a Makefile.
Ofcourse, you could skip this procedure and just make a local Makefile, or even build the source code ommiting the use of make.
Go ahead and modify the contents of this folder. No harm done!
